channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Cuts to public media will smash budgets of some local radio stations
item.description: Congress voted to claw back federal funding to public media. Some of those hit hardest include community radio stations in areas that voted for the pr...

item.title: 32 Palestinians killed trying to reach food distribution hubs, Gaza authorities say
item.description: Palestinians were shot dead during a food distribution on Saturday at a center run by a U.S.- and Israeli-backed group in southern Gaza, hospital offi...

item.title: "48 Hours" show schedule
item.description: True crime. Real justice. To miss it would be a crime.

item.title: Did goofy talk between a couple mimicking cartoon characters lead to murder?
item.description: Linda Duffey shot her husband Patrick in their suburban California home — that is clear. What's not so clear is what led up to the shooting.

item.title: 21st century technology used to help solve Wisconsin mom's murder
item.description: A man suspected in his girlfriend's murder swears he didn't do it – can his Fitbit prove he's innocent?

item.title: 7/19: CBS Weekend News
item.description: Driver crashes into line of people in L.A., police say he was shot; Artist creates massive designs, visible only until the tide rolls in

item.title: Social media revamp by 92-year-old president struggles to woo young Cameroonians
item.description: Paul Biya is the world's oldest president and wants to show he is on the pulse, but many are not convinced.

item.title: 3 people are still missing from deadly July 4 floods in Texas county, down from nearly 100
Mr and Mrs XCX: Brat star weds drummer of The 1975
item.description: Pop star Charli XCX tied the knot with the drummer of band The 1975 on Saturday.

item.title: Parades, flags and songs: The campaign to force Ukrainian children to love Russia
item.description: Russian youth organisations are encouraging Ukrainian children to turn against their country.

item.title: At least 37 dead as tourist boat capsizes in Vietnam
item.description: The incident happened in Vietnam's popular Ha Long Bay during bad weather, with five people still missing, local reports say.

item.title: Vehicle plows into Los Angeles crowd, injuring 30 people
item.description: A driver drove into a crowd in East Hollywood, injuring 30 people, according to the Los Angeles Fire Department. Police believe the crash was an inten...

item.title: Syria struggles to quell deadly Bedouin-Druze clashes in south
item.description: Hundreds of people have died in clashes between Bedouin and Druze fighters in Suweida, reports say, as the authorities seek to reimpose order.

item.title: Examining the role of men in the gender gap in American society
item.description: The latest season of the podcast "Unsettled" from Iowa Public Radio looks at how gender affects people's everyday lives.

item.title: A surprise twist in the Trump administration's use of third country deportations
item.description: Chris Camponovo, a former State Department lawyer, examines what a multi-national prisoner swap says about the Trump administration's third country de...

item.title: Police are investigating a man's death after he was pulled into MRI machine
item.description: New York police said the 61-year-old man was wearing a large metal chain that caused him to be "drawn into the machine." The FDA warns that MRI scan c...

item.title: New airport scanners are better at spotting liquid explosives, but many airports lack them
Car strikes crowd outside Los Angeles venue, injuring 30. Bystanders attack driver, who was shot
item.description: At least three people were in critical condition after being injured along Santa Monica Boulevard in East Hollywood.
